Endocrinology
Fig 5.22 Neuroendocrinology: emotions  thoughts  actions. As Michelangelo foretold (in his 
Creation of Adam) ‘all gods and demons that have ever existed are within us as possibilities, de-
sires, and ways of escape’. Within the dark red vault of our skull we see human and god-like forms 
reaching out, as thoughts escape into actions—with legs extending into our brainstem (B) and a 
ﬁ st is pushing from our hypothalamus into the pituitary stalk (P). Above the pituitary we have 
thoughts, ideas, impulses, and neurotransmitters. Below we have hormones. Between is the realm 
of neuroendocrinology—the neurosecretory cells which turn emotions into the releasing factors 
for the pituitary hormones (ﬁ g 5.4).
Image courtesy of Gary Bevans; quote from Frank Lynn Meshberger. Michelangelo, Renaissance Man of 
the Brain, Too?
